Text:
There is no real 64bit version of minecraft! Just google for java and download the 64bit version of java... and not this peace of s*** here!

Every version since 1.2 (correct me if im wrong) is capable of running in the 64bit java environment, with all the benefits from 64bit applications.

You can assign more RAM to JRE manually. You just have to add some parameters to the JRE. Google will help ;)

@oopsta01

You can download the serial from Rapidshare. The setup will send you automatically to the serial, so don't close your internet browser. Good luck with your instal!
